sentences.english: Homo erectus was also physically similar to modern humans with large brains and bodies.
sentences.chinese: 直立人具有大的腦髓，身體特徵也與現代人相似。

sentences.english: We know that Neanderthals had big brains like ours.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道穴居人有向我們一樣的大腦髓。

sentences.english: What's worse than zombies who eat brains?
sentences.chinese: 還有比殭屍喫掉腦髓更恐怖的事情嗎？

sentences.english: As he expected, only brain extracts were active.
sentences.chinese: 不出他所料，只有腦髓的提取物有效。

definition: fontanel (gap between the bones of an infant's skull)
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
